decision_conditions: <p>The proposed two storey rear extension by reason of excessive width and combined crown roof would totally subsume the proportions of these semi-detached houses and result in unduly bulky and disproportionate additions to the host dwellings. Furthermore, the single storey rear extension by reason of its design, roof form and fenestration fails to harmonise with the character and appearance of the host buildings and the wider locality, and would fail to respect the character and appearance of the pair of semis, neighbouring properties and the prevailing pattern of development in the locality contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3 (D(1) and (11)) of The&nbsp; London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 A, DM1 B (a), (b) and (c) of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).<br></p>
description: Two storey side to rear extension; single storey rear extension; alterations and extension to roof;  rear dormer; rooflights in front and side roofslopes; external alterations to 11 South Close.   Single storey front extension; single and two storey side to rear extension; single storey rear extension; alterations and extension to roof;  rear dormer; rooflights in front and side roofslopes; external alterations to 12 South Close (demolition of rear extension)
